continuanter: <entryFree id="n10826" type="main" key="conti^nu^anter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭanter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātē</orth>, <sense id="n10826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. 2. continuo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, 1. and 2.</sense></entryFree>
continuatim: <entryFree id="n10827" type="main" key="conti^nu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. continuo</etym>, <sense id="n10827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuously</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sunhmme/nws, sunexw=s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 112:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 112, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
continuatio: <entryFree id="n10828" type="main" key="conti^nu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a following of one thing after another, an unbroken series, a connection, continuation, succession</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10828.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio seriesque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio immutabilis ordinis sempiterni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrium,</quote> <trans><tr>an uninterrupted succession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: laborum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:79 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 79 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 23 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (rebus) peragendis continuatio ipsa efficacissima esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10828.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a period; absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl> and 208; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO">9, 4, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
continuativus: <entryFree id="n10829" type="gloss" key="conti^nu^a_tivus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātivus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>continuo</etym>, <sense id="n10829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to connect the discourse, copulative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 16, p. 1027</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
continue: <entryFree id="n10830" type="main" key="conti^nu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. continuus <sense id="n10830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
continuitas: <entryFree id="n10831" type="main" key="conti^nu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>continuus</etym>, <sense id="n10831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connected series, continuation</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
continuo: <entryFree id="n10832" type="main" key="conti^nu^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. continuus <sense id="n10832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10833" type="main" key="conti^nu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>continuus</etym>. <sense id="n10833.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to join together in uninterrupted succession, to make continuous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10833.1" n="A" level="2"> In space, <hi rend="ital">to join one with another, to connect, unite</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>); constr. with the <case>dat.</case> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10833.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) mari continuatus et junctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Alyattei Campis Mygdoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus lateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 496</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Medial: Suionibus Sitonum gentes continuantur,</quote> <trans><tr>border upon, are next to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10833.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas aut amplius domos,</quote> <trans><tr>to erect in rows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos in agro Casinati optimos et fructuosissimos,</quote> <trans><tr>to buy, acquire contiguous plots of ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (v. the pass. in connection); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latissime agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, quā Palatium et Maecenatis hortos continuaverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to connect together in a period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba verbis aut nomina nominibus (just before: cadentia similiter jungere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—Medial: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (atomi) cohaerescunt inter se et aliae alias adprehendentes continuantur,</quote> <trans><tr>hang together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.4" n="B" level="2"> Of time and objects relating to it, <hi rend="ital">to join, connect together, to continue uninterruptedly, to do successively one thing after another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius die ac nocte continuato itinere ad eum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius diem noctemque itinere continuato ingentem attulit terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continens die ac nocte proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpotationem biduo duabusque noctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem noctemque potando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">theatro dies totos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturam ei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give it to him immediately after the ædileship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 3</bibl></cit>: dapes. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatio continuati laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (libertas) usque ad hoc tempus honoribus, imperiis ... continuata permansit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to slay one after another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:292" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 292</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos hastis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 745</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemi continuatur hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paci externae confestim discordia domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna damnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to continue, last</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">febres ita ut coepere continuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:35" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 5, 17, § 35</bibl>.— Hence, * </sense><sense id="n10833.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., continuously, in uninterrupted succession</hi> (opp. carptim), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭ-nŭātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in uninterrupted succession</hi>, <cb n="CONT" /> <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=315:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 315, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314:32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314, 32</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Diff. Verb. p. 2195" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Diff. Verb. p. 2195</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
continuor: <entryFree id="n10834" type="main" key="conti^nu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form of continuo (rare and mostly post-class.), <hi rend="ital">to unite one's self to, to join</hi>: Marius ostio Liris evehitur, adque Aenariam suos continuatur, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde me commodum egredientem continuatur Pytheas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 172, 34; 6, p. 180, 24; 11, p. 259, 26; Enar. Pan. Const. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:44" default="NO">4, 44</bibl>; cf. continuo, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
continuus: <entryFree id="n10835" type="main" key="conti^nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contineo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joining, connecting with something</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hanging together</hi>, in space or time, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted, continuous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10835.1" n="I" level="1"> Of space (so mostly Aug. and post-Aug.; cf., however, continue); with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10835.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër continuus terrae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: Leucada continuam veteres habuere coloni; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc freta circuëunt,</quote> <trans><tr>joined to the mainland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis proxima quaeque et deinceps continua amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 5</bibl>: montes, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluere continuo alveo (Euphraten),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus uno alveo continuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui vice dentium continuo osse gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia continua et paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:517" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 517</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he who is always about one, an attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocceius Nerva, continuus principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit> (32) Halm, Draeg. ad loc. (Nipperd. and Ritter, principi).—</sense><sense id="n10835.4" n="B" level="2"> Tron., of rhet. matters (most freq. in Quint.): cum fluxerunt plures continuae translationes (the figure derived from an uninterrupted, flowing stream; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositio (opp. partita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exordio usque ad ultimam vocem continuus quidam gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:1" default="NO">6, 4, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>. 7, 14 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10835.5" n="II" level="1"> Of time and objects relating to it, <hi rend="ital">following one after another, successive, continuous</hi> (class. in all periods and species of composition): auferet ex oculis veniens Aurora Boöten; <cit><quote lang="la">continuāque die sidus Hyantis erit,</quote> <trans><tr>the next day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:734" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 734</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">continuā nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>the following night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:720" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduum continuum, dies decem continuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:146 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 146 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies quinque ex eo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos prope quinquaginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus noctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secutae sunt continuos complures dies tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> prioribus diebus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot an nos continuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58</bibl>: itinera, Lepid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo tri umphi ex Hispaniā acti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incom moda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: messe senescit ager; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (patricios) ab Atto Clauso continuos duravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. resp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus inde et saevus accusandis reis Suilius,</quote> <trans><tr>incessant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postulandis reis tam continuus annus fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>incessantly occupied</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence the <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n10835.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭ-nŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">continuously, without interruption;</hi> in space or time (very rare, perh. only anteand post-class. for continenter, assidue): <cit><quote lang="la">* flumen quod fluit continue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 27</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus jugiter et continue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 376, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭō</orth>. </sense><sense id="n10835.8" n="A" level="2"> To designate an act that in time immediately follows something, <hi rend="ital">immediately, forthwith, directly, without delay</hi>, = statim, <foreign lang="greek">au)ti/ka</foreign> (very freq. in all periods and kinds of composition). </sense><sense id="n10835.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10835.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Corresp. with the particles of time: ubi, ut, postquam, cum, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum terram tetigimus, Continuo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 51 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ut aspexi, me continuo contuli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">iste continuo ut vidit, non dubitavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque insanus ... latum demisit pectore clavum, Audit continuo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: nam postquam audivi <pb n="451" /> <cb n="CONT" /> ... cominuo argentum dedi, Ut emeretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te summis laudibus ad caelum extulerunt, mihi continuo maximas gratias agant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vel continuo patuit, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mora sit, si innuerim, quin pugnus continuo in malā haereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: si quid narrare occepi, continuo dari Tibi verba censes, <hi rend="ital">forthwith you think</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1091</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo consilium dimisit (Q. Maximus), simulac me fractum ac debilitatum metu viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo, ventis surgentibus, aut freta ponti Incipiunt agitata tumescere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo hic ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: haud mora; <cit><quote lang="la">continuo matris praecepta facessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 548</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 362</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. with statim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod lubet, non lubet jam id continuo,</quote> <trans><tr>the next moment, immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos prius intro ducam et quae volo Simul inperabo: poste continuo exeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: hanc mihi in manum dat; <cit><quote lang="la">mors continuo ipsam occupat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hercle ego te barbā continuo arripiam, et in ignem coniciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: egomet continuo mecum; <cit><quote lang="la">certe captus est!</quote> <trans><tr>I immediately thought within myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus est continuo convocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos continuo in itinere adorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitae necessitates continuo agendi,</quote> <trans><tr>on the spot, immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: perturbationes, amplificatae certe, pestiferae sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">igitur etiam susceptae continuo in magnā pestis parte versantur,</quote> <trans><tr>even immediately on their inception</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.12" n="2" level="3"> Of a point of time closely following a time named, <hi rend="ital">speedily, without interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde absens factus aedilis, continuo praetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui summam spem civium, quam de eo jam puero habuerant, continuo adulescens incredibili virtute superavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.13" n="3" level="3"> Esp., with the statement of a logical consequence from a fact; only in connection with a negative, or a question implying a negative, <hi rend="ital">not by consequence, not necessarily, not as an immediate consequence</hi>, in questions; <hi rend="ital">perhaps then? perhaps therefore?</hi> (very freq. in Cic.); with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non continuo, si me in gregem sicariorum contuli, sum sicarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 94</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 204</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 345</bibl>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nec omnes, qui curari se passi sunt, continuo etiam convalescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ego summum dolorem ... non continuo dico esse brevem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: aeque enim contingit omnibus fidibus, ut incontentae sint; <cit><quote lang="la">illud non continuo, ut aeque incontentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malo careat, continuone fruitur summo bono?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">continuone si? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.14" n="B" level="2"> In Quint. twice (for the ante- and post-class. continue), <hi rend="ital">in an uninterrupted series, one after another, continuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis (labor) fuit illius, qui grana ciceris ex spatio distante missa, in acum continuo et sine frustratione inserebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:11" default="NO">9, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contio: <entryFree id="n10836" type="main" key="conti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">concĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from conventio, for which COVENTIO is written in S. C. Bacch.; v. conventio, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 43</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 4</bibl>, and p. 113, 10 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n10836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting, assembly that is called together by a magistrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">priest</hi> (cf.: contio significat conventum, non tamen alium quam eum qui a magistratu vel a sacerdote publico per praeconem convocatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 4</bibl>; cf. contionor—In good prose). </sense><sense id="n10836.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">advocat contionem, habet orationem talem consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">advocare contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">advocare contionem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocare populum in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad contionem advocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem ad contionem vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in vestram contionem evocaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convocatis ad contionem militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold a meeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem habere, II. infra): in contione dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:213 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 213 sq.</bibl></cit>; of. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 168</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem populi prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cb n="CONT" /> quae ego de te in senatu egerim, quae in contionibus dixerim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so in opp. to the Senate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare aliquem pro contione,</quote> <trans><tr>before the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10, 14 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:8 al" default="NO">4, 4, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc in mille curias contionesque dispersam et dissipatam esse rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contio conventusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contio, quae ex imperitissimis constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togata et urbana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis fluctibus contionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 48</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">contionum procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabant pro contione legiones destrictis gladiis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner of an assembly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit> Draeg. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10836.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a discourse, oration before a public assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi contionem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">audiri jam et legi novas contiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere contionem ... quā in oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contionis habendae potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem apud milites habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 9</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit super eā re contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contione contra Catilinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funebres tristes atque summissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Cicero dicit contra contionem Metelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl>; and the few fragments of this oration of <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> in Orell. IV. 2, p. 455 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:67" default="NO">3, 8, 67</bibl>.—Of the orations reported in a history: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (sc. Thucydides) contionibus melior, hic (sc. Herodotus) sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10836.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place for speaking, a tribune, rostrum;</hi> mostly in the phrases in contionem ascendere or escendere: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magistratum inieris et in contionem ascenderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem escendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 3, 49, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 50, 8: Perseus in contionem processit Philippum secum filium habens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: contionem tria significare: locum suggestumque unde verba fierent, ... coetum populi adsistentis, item orationem ipsam, Verr. Fl. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contionabundus: <entryFree id="n10837" type="main" key="conti^o_na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contionor</etym>, <sense id="n10837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proposing something</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haranguing in a public assembly</hi> (several times in Livy; elsewh. very rare). </sense><sense id="n10837.1" n="1" level="3"> In a bad sense; with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec prope contionabundus circumibat homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10837.2" n="2" level="3"> In a good sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
contionalis: <entryFree id="n10838" type="main" key="conti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contio</etym>, <sense id="n10838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable for an assembly of the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionalis prope clamor senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirudo aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans><tr>who went about in the assemblies of the people for the purpose of exciting the multitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. comitialis.</sense></entryFree>
contionarius: <entryFree id="n10839" type="main" key="conti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suited to an assembly of the people</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
contionator: <entryFree id="n10840" type="main" key="conti^o_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contionor</etym>, <sense id="n10840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a haranguer of the people;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a demagogue, a political agitator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl> (opp. animus vere popularis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1, p. 171" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1, p. 171</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contionator, allocutor multitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contionatorius: <entryFree id="n10841" type="spur" key="conti^o_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnātōrĭus</orth>, false read. for contionarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
contionor: <entryFree id="n10842" type="main" key="conti^o_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭōnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>contio</etym>. * <sense id="n10842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be convened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">united in an assembly, to form an assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc illi vos, singuli universos contionantes timent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10842.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to contio, II.) <hi rend="ital">To deliver an oration before an assembly of the people, to harangue, address</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius contionari ex turri altā solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superiore e loco contionari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad populum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Caesare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; and entirely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: cum Lepidus contionaretur, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO">3, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:3" default="NO">7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec velut contionanti Minucio circum fundebatur tribunorum multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—Once with the <cb n="CONT" /> <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. the foll.): <cit><quote lang="la">C. Cato contionatus est, comitia haberi non siturum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>declared before the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10842.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to say publicly, publish, make known, declare</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">caterva tota clarissimā concentione .. contionata est: huic vitae tuae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem hoc futurum, etiam Sibylla contionata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18, p. 292</bibl></cit> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
contiro: <entryFree id="n10843" type="gloss" key="conti_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tīro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-recruit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3559</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contiuncula: <entryFree id="n10844" type="main" key="conti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contio</etym>, <sense id="n10844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short harangue, a trifling speech</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem excludi ab omni doctrina, ac tantum in judicia et contiunculas tamquam in aliquod pistrinum detrudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contogatus: <entryFree id="n10845" type="hapax" key="conto^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŏgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a law colleague</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contollo: <entryFree id="n10846" type="hapax" key="contollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bring together</hi>: contollam gradum, <hi rend="ital">will go to meet him</hi> ( = contra tollam, Wagn. ad loc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 6</bibl> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
contonat: <entryFree id="n10847" type="hapax" key="conto^nat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŏnat</orth>, <sense id="n10847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers., it thunders heavily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi continuo contonat Sonitu maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contor: <entryFree id="n10848" type="main" key="contor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. cunctor <sense id="n10848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contorqueo: <entryFree id="n10849" type="main" key="contorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>torsi, tortum</itype> (also -torsum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, p. 871</bibl> P.), 2, <sense id="n10849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to turn, twist, twirl, swing, whirl</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brandish</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10849.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10849.2" n="A" level="2"> Of weapons, arms, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">telum contortum validis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:971" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 971</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenta spicula lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastile adducto lacerto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspidem lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valido sceptrum lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:422" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hastile) certo contorquens dirigit ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed magnum stridens contorta phalarica venit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam In latus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum in eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10849.3" n="B" level="2"> Of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernaclum quolibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 904</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra quocumque volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:900" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 900</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globum eā celeritate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 61</bibl>: equum magnā vi, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis in alium cursum contortos et deflexos videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proram ad laevas undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas insano vortice,</quote> <trans><tr>whirling them round in its raging whirlpool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 481</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frementes aquas subitis verticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 102</bibl></cit> Weber; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 631</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an omnis tempestas aeque mare illud contorqueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:1 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex est contorta in se aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:309" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10849.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly in Cic. and of rhet. matters; <cit><quote lang="la">the metaphor taken from missiles which are brandished, that they may be discharged with greater force): (auditor) tamquam machinatione aliquā tum ad severitatem, tum ad remissionem animi est contorquendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>.—So of discourse that is <hi rend="ital">thrown out violently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forcibly, hurled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenis non tam vibrarent fulmina illa, nisi numeris contorta ferrentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 234</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam rhetorice! quam copiose! quas sententias colligit! quae verba contorquet! ( = summā vi et impetu profert),</quote> <trans><tr>hurls forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longas periodos uno spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde contorquent et ita concludunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>twist the argument</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 51, 106</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), of discourse. </sense><sense id="n10849.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Brandished, hurled, full of motion, powerful, vehement, energetic, strong</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly in Cic.): contorta et acris oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis (orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levibus mulcentur et contortis excitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10849.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Involved, intricate, obscure, perplexed, complicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contortae et difficiles res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>: contorta et aculeata quaedam <foreign lang="greek">sofi/smata</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tortē</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">intricately, perplexedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl>. —* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concluduntur a Stoicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
contorreo: <entryFree id="n10850" type="hapax" key="contorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-torrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <sense id="n10850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to dry up entirely, to parch, scorch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contorte: <entryFree id="n10851" type="main" key="contorte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contorqueo, <sense id="n10851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contortio: <entryFree id="n10852" type="main" key="contorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contorqueo</etym>. * <sense id="n10852.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whirling round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, <pb n="452" /> <cb n="CONT" /> 19, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10852.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An intertwining, involving; intricacy, complication;</hi> of discourse, in the <number>plur.</number>: contortiones orationis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:50" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contortor: <entryFree id="n10853" type="hapax" key="contortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n10853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrester, perverter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contortulus: <entryFree id="n10854" type="hapax" key="contortu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [contortus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat complicated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intricate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contortulis quibusdam ac minutis conclusiunculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contortuplicatus: <entryFree id="n10855" type="gloss" key="contortu^pli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortŭplĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tortĭp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contortus-plico</etym>, <sense id="n10855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">entangled, complicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>compounded in a complicated manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contortus: <entryFree id="n10856" type="main" key="contortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contorqueo.</entryFree>
contra: <entryFree id="n10857" type="main" key="contra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>stem con, i. e. cum, through a comparative form conter; cf.: alter, uter, inter, praeter, etc.; in <hi rend="ital">abl. fem.</hi> form like the locative adverbs eā, quā, etc.; cf.: ultrā, intrā, extrā, citrā</etym>, orig., <sense id="n10857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in comparison with;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">over against, fronting, in front, opposite, in opposition to, against, contrary to, opposed to</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10857.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (referring to an opposed object often with the force of a preposition with ellipsis of a pronoun, = <hi rend="ital">against it, against him</hi>, etc.). </sense><sense id="n10857.2" n="A" level="2"> Local. </sense><sense id="n10857.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of position in front of a person, place, or thing. </sense><sense id="n10857.4" n="a" level="4"> With verb of being or position expressed or understood. </sense><sense id="n10857.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to living beings, <hi rend="ital">opposite, in face of, face to face, facing, in front of, fronting, confronting</hi> (not in Cic., Caes., or Sall.): <cit><quote lang="la">feminam scelestam te, adstans contra, contuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut confidenter mihi contra adstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:929" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 929</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum contra, quoad longissume oculi ferebant, animo finivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat contra starique jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:290" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat contra dicitque tibi tua pagina Fures!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:55:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 55, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus erat contra,</quote> <trans><tr>in front of her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa vides contra,</quote> <trans><tr>in front (of us)</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:587" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 587</bibl></cit>.—Of position in front of the enemy: <cit><quote lang="la">contra consertā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: contra consistere, <hi rend="ital">to make front against</hi> them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Referring to things and places, <hi rend="ital">over against (it), opposite (to it), on the opposite side</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">contra jacet Cancer patulam distentus in alvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positā contra Hispaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promuntorium quod contra procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: relinquendae autem contra erunt vacuae tabellae, <hi rend="ital">on the opposite side</hi>, i. e. of the leaf, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl>: illo quaerente cur non decidant contra siti, <hi rend="ital">the antipodes</hi> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl>; v. II. A. 1. c. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 161</bibl>.—With the governing verb understood: <cit><quote lang="la">arguam hanc vidisse apud te contra conservum meum,</quote> <trans><tr>face to face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam omnia contra circaque hostium plena erant, Liv 5, 37, 8: eadem verba contra (i. e. ponuntur),</quote> <trans><tr>side by side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.7" n="b" level="4"> With verbs of motion, <hi rend="ital">so as to be opposite</hi> to an object or <hi rend="ital">face to face</hi> with a person, variously rendered. </sense><sense id="n10857.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Referring to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">accede ad me atque adi contra,</quote> <trans><tr>come right up to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 6</bibl>: hostes crebri cadunt; nostri contra ingruunt, <hi rend="ital">advance to their front</hi> (in Plàut. hostility is not implied in contra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl>: quis nos pater aut cognatu' volet contra tueri, <hi rend="ital">face to face, eye to eye</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 12</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 444 Rib.); Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1, 55</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 538 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">adspicedum contra me = contra adspice me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad lec.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra adspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum veniret contra Marcianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ubi sol radiis ... Adversā fulsit nimborum aspergine contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 525</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (turrim) promoti contra validi asseres ... perfregere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>.—Reciprocally: oscula non pervenientia contra, <hi rend="ital">not coming through</hi> (the wall) <hi rend="ital">so as to meet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to equivalents of weight, value, and price; so, </sense><sense id="n10857.11" n="(a)" level="5"> In Plaut. only in the colloq. phrases auro contra, aurichalco contra, and contra auro (sc. posito); lit., <hi rend="ital">for gold placed against;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aes contrarium, s. v. contrarius: (servus) non carus'st auro contra,</quote> <trans><tr>at his weight in gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: jam auro contra constat filius, <cb n="CONT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 57</bibl> (Speng. aurichalco): auro contra cedo modestum amatorem! A me aurum accipe. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Cedo mihi contra aurichalco quoi ego sano serviam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:45 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 45 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.12" n="(b)" level="5"> In post-Aug. prose (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">at si aquae et ejus rei quam contra pensabis par pondus erit, nec pessum ibit, nec exstabit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.13" n="3" level="3"> Of reciprocal actions, = vicissim, <hi rend="ital">in turn, in return, back, on my, his, etc., part, likewise, counter-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10857.14" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut deludam contra, lusorem meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me amat, quam ego contra amo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5</bibl></cit>. 2, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui arguat se, eum contra vincat jurejurando suo,</quote> <trans><tr>make a victorious counter-charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si laudabit haec Illius formam, tu hujus contra (i. e. lauda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audi nunc contra jam,</quote> <trans><tr>listen in turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu mihi contra nunc videre fortunatus, Phaedria, Cui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>you likewise seem fortunate to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mettius Tullo gratulatur, contra Tullus Mettium benigne alloquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ut me diligat illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76</bibl></cit>. 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 27</bibl> Orell. ad loc.—Hence, with ellipsis of inquit, = respondit: <cit><quote lang="la">cui latrans contra senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scietis, inquam, etc., contra Nigrinus: ad quem missi sunt? ego, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely with inquit, etc., expressed: at ille contra, renidens, Audi, inquit, discipule, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra talia reddit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B.
