Th. 9, 23, 1, § 2.—</sense><sense id="n10894.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10894.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch in examining, to search</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne feminae praetextatique pueri et puellae contrectarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch carnally, to have illicit intercourse with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrectata filiarum pudicitia,</quote> <trans><tr>violated, dishonored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.7" n="3" level="3"> In the Lat. of the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi>: rem alienam, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10894.8" n="b" level="4"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to take by stealth, to steal, purloin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:3 al" default="NO">25, 2, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10894.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to contemplate, look at, consider, dwell upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudare corpus et contrectandum vulgi oculis permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente varias voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia et disciplinas philosophiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply one's self to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremisco: <entryFree id="n10895" type="main" key="contre^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmisco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10895.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to tremble all over, to shake, quake</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totā mente atque omnibus artubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: toto corpore contremisco, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contremuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 835</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 761</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10895.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in meā causā numquam fides virtusque contremuit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have never wavered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contremescis senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10895.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to shake on account of something, to tremble at a thing, be afraid of</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non contremiscamus injurias, non vulnera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl>: periculum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem Italia contremuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremo: <entryFree id="n10896" type="main" key="contre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to tremble greatly, to quake</hi> (rare): caelum tonitru contremit, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 413 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis horribili cum plagā torrida tellus Contremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1220</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contremulus: <entryFree id="n10897" type="hapax" key="contre^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., trembling violently</hi>: (luna), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 351, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contribulatio: <entryFree id="n10898" type="hapax" key="contri_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrībŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contribulo</etym>, <sense id="n10898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl></cit> ex Isa. 65, 14.</sense></entryFree>
contribulis: <entryFree id="n10899" type="main" key="contri^bu_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĭbūlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n10899.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the same</hi> tribus (very rare), Inscr. Fratr. Arv. Marin. p. 43; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 873, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Gal. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n10899.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of the same religion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contribulo: <entryFree id="n10900" type="main" key="contri_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trībŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n10900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to crush, bruise</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">capita draconum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:73:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 73, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 35, 22 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10900.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to afflict much, to crush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium Deo spiritus contribulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem contribulati abicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contribuo: <entryFree id="n10901" type="main" key="contri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>trĭbŭi, trĭbūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to throw together, bring together, unite, incorporate, impart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10901.1" n="I" level="1"> Of a part added to or united with a whole. </sense><sense id="n10901.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10901.3" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non Penëus, nec non Spercheïdes undae Contribuere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 231</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprios ego tecum, Sit modo fas, annos contribuisse velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodesse putat apibus vetustate corruptis examen novum contribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos (annos) tibi contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 15</bibl> pr.: CONTRIBVTVS EX LEGIONE III. GALLICAE (LEGIONI), Inscr. Afric. ap. Renier, 1357.—</sense><sense id="n10901.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10901.7" n="1" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to add, join</hi> a district, city, etc., to a people, government, etc., <hi rend="ital">to annex.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10901.8" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oscenses et Calagurritani, qui erant cum Oscensibus contributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> Kramer ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10901.9" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocenses Locrenseque ... iis (Aetolis) contribuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epirotis Ambraciam placebat adgredi, quae tum contribuerat se Aetolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 26, 2</bibl>: Uxiorum dein gentem subactam Susianorum satrapae contribuit,<cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in (agro) Gallico, qui nunc Piceno contribuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Urbana colonia Sullana nuper Capua contributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(regna) isdem quibus ademerat reddidit, aut alienigenis contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To admit, bring into</hi> a league or union: <cit><quote lang="la">polliceri ... Corinthum contributuros in anticum gentis concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elei, nuper in Achaicum (concilium) contributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Elei per se ipsi quam per Romanos maluerunt Achaïco contribui concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 35, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.11" n="II" level="1"> Of several objects united in one whole. </sense><sense id="n10901.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring together, unite, collect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi simul plura contribuuntur, ex quibus unum medicamentum fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:27:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 27, § 1</bibl></cit>: utilius est ... contributa habere remedia, <hi rend="ital">to have them treated together in one place</hi>, instead of scattered through the work, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 15, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam pagatim habitantes ... in unam urbem contributi majores sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">una ex iis (urbibus) quae ad condendam Megalen polin ex concilio Arcadum contributae forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10901.13" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to dispose, arrange, classify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in octo tribus contribuerentur novi cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter frumenta panicum et milium ponenda sunt, quamvis jam leguminibus ea contribuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unam cohortem eos (milites) contribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contributio: <entryFree id="n10902" type="main" key="contri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contribuo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n10902.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing, distributing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debiti et crediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contributionem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 7, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:30:section=8" default="NO">35, 2, 30, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10902.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contribution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contributus: <entryFree id="n10903" type="main" key="contri^bu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contribuo.</entryFree>
contristatio: <entryFree id="n10904" type="main" key="contrista_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contristātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contristo</etym>, <sense id="n10904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an afflicting, affliction, grief</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contristo: <entryFree id="n10905" type="main" key="contristo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tristo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tristis</etym>, <sense id="n10905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful, to sadden, afflict</hi> (except in Caelius, perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10905.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: contristavit haec sententia Balbum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens ... non perturbatur nec contristatur nec timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of bees,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10905.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10905.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the weather, light, colors, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make dark, render gloomy, to cloud, dim, darken, sadden</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster pluvio frigore caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 279</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius ... laevo contristat lumine caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 275</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquarius annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram silvā super opacā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:427" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores (opp. exhilarare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10905.4" n="B" level="2"> Of vines, <hi rend="ital">to injure, hurt, damage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites caloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:1 al" default="NO">3, 20, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contritio: <entryFree id="n10906" type="main" key="contri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contero</etym>, <sense id="n10906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grinding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10906.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10906.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">contrition, grief</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">qli/yis</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 30, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">59, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contritus: <entryFree id="n10907" type="main" key="contri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contero.</entryFree>
controversia: <entryFree id="n10908" type="main" key="contro_versi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n10908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> CONTROVORSEIS, C. I. L. 1, 199, 1), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>controversus</etym>, lit., <hi rend="ital">a turning against.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n10908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si controversia aquae insulam subverterit,</quote> <trans><tr>the turning of the water against it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:24:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 24, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">controversy, contention, quarrel, question, dispute, debate</hi> (so in good prose, and very freq., esp. in jurid. and rhet. lang.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Quint. more than sixty times): nulla controversia mihi tecum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apage! controversia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est quod in controversiā aut in contentione versetur ... a propriis personis et temporibus semper avocet controversiam (orator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 14, 45</bibl></cit> (cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:de Or. 3:30:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversias tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Phil. 9:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Caecin. 2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in controversiam vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:de Or. 2:72:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem adducere in controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 1:40:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem deducere in controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ducere in controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire in controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:44 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 44 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tum agrum, qui in controversiā erat, obtinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in controversiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiae scholasticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as the title of a rhet. writing of Seneca: Controversiae: existere controversias ex scripti interpretatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 143</bibl></cit>: dicere,<cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 21 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut controversiarum ac dissensionum obliviscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus hereditatis controversia fuerat nulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere controversiam nominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de loco et tempore ejus rei controversia inferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea controversia, quam habet de fundo cum quodam Colophonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de substantiā aut de qualitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia est inter scriptores de numero annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia orta inter eos de principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia non erat, quin verum dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil controversiae fuit, quin consules crearentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine controversiā ab dis solus diligere,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond dispute, without doubt, indisputably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā controversiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
controversialis: <entryFree id="n10909" type="main" key="contro_versi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>controversia</etym>, <sense id="n10909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to controversy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dispute, controversial</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
controversiola: <entryFree id="n10910" type="hapax" key="contro_versi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little controversy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Rufin. 1, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
controversiosus: <entryFree id="n10911" type="main" key="contro_versi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much controverted</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
controversor: <entryFree id="n10912" type="main" key="contro_versor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>controversus</etym>, <sense id="n10912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be at variance one with another, to dispute</hi> (very rare): ut inter vos de hujuscemodi rebus controversemini, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 803</bibl> P. (IV. 2, p. 477 Orell.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil invicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
controversus: <entryFree id="n10913" type="main" key="contro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrō-versus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from the same root with contra; q. v. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>. * <sense id="n10913.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">turned against, in an opposite direction</hi> (cf. controversia, I.; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): perticae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora Isauriae scopulis,</quote> <trans><tr>lying opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 15, 7</bibl> (al. contra versus).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10913.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10913.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is the subject of dispute, controverted, disputed, questionable</hi> (several times in Cic. and Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): sumere istos pro certo, quod dubium controversumque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. confessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:14" default="NO">5, 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:5" default="NO">7, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res controversa et plena dissensionis inter doctissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:2" default="NO">5, 9, 2</bibl>. auspicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 42, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrōversa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">disputed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doubtful points</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversa confessis probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10913.3" n="B" level="2"> = repugnans, <hi rend="ital">repugnant, at strife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversa sibi ac repugnantia (sc. terra et ignis),</quote> <trans><tr>in controversy with themselves, opposed to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Aus. Ephem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (The signification <hi rend="ital">quarrelsome, litigious</hi>, is very dub., the reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 46</bibl>, being undoubtedly corrupt.)</sense></entryFree>
contrucido: <entryFree id="n10914" type="main" key="contru^ci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trŭcīdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to hew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut to pieces, to cut down, to put to the sword, slay</hi> (rare, but in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10914.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitato corpore et contrucidato se abjecit exanimatus (cf., shortly after, concisum vulneribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plebem immisso milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 43 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum opima corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestias ad munus populi comparatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10914.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi summi imperii nomine armati rem publicam contrucidaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>cut in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit> (v. the figure in connection).</sense></entryFree>
contrudo: <entryFree id="n10915" type="main" key="contru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10915.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowd together</hi> (mostly anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (vis venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 510</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 211</bibl> and 734: <cit><quote lang="la">penitusque casa contrusa jacebant Corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>crowded together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10915.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To press, thrust, push</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crowd in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam in dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stantis equi corpus ... videtur vis in adversum flumen contrudere, aliquos in balneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 31</bibl> Müll. —Rarely of a single person: <cit><quote lang="la">Florentius ... contrusus est in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contrunco: <entryFree id="n10916" type="main" key="contrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-trunco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cut down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to pieces</hi> (ante- and post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: inermes et obsistentes, Lampr. Alex. Sev. <pb n="460" /> <cb n="CONT" /> 61.—Facete: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offulam grandiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles palearum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 222, 37.</sense></entryFree>
contrusus: <entryFree id="n10917" type="main" key="contru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contrūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contrudo.</entryFree>
contubernalis: <entryFree id="n10918" type="main" key="contu^berna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭbernālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<case>abl.</case> contubernale. Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl> P., or Com. Rel. v. 73, where Rib. reads contubernaleio; <sense id="n10918.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">usu. -nali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:31:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 31, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:220:section=1" default="NO">50, 16, 220, § 1</bibl>) [contubernium]. </sense><sense id="n10918.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10918.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tent-companion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi> (usu. ten men and a decanus in one tent), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl> and 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:21:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 21, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3557</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n10918.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A young man who, in order to become familiar with military service, attended a general in war, an attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Pompeio proconsuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10918.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from military affairs. </sense><sense id="n10918.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a comrade, companion, mate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi in consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meus in consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: praeclarae (ironically of harlots), Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl> Spald.; also, <cit><quote lang="la">iron.: Quirini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cæsar, whose statue stood in the temple of Quirinus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 45, 3</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10918.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in colloq. lang., <hi rend="ital">the husband</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wife of a slave</hi> (given by their master); <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:7" default="NO">12, 3, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:220" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 220</bibl>.— Hence, facete: nisi illa nos volt ... omnis crucibus contubernalis dari, qs. <hi rend="ital">to be united in wedlock with the cross</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contubernium: <entryFree id="n10919" type="main" key="contu^berni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭbernĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>taberna</etym>. <sense id="n10919.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr. </sense><sense id="n10919.1" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. (cf. contubernalis, I.). </sense><sense id="n10919.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Tent-companionship, a dwelling together in a tent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the legions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10919.3" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a body of soldiers occupying a tent together, a mess, squad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant decani decem militibus propositi, qui nunc caput contubernii vocantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10919.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The intercourse of a young man and the general accompanied by him in war, attendance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10919.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the sphere of milit. operations. </sense><sense id="n10919.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The accompanying, attendance</hi> (of teachers, friends, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10919.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic., </sense><sense id="n10919.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The marriage of slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10919.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Ironically, in distinction from conubium: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernium muliebris militiae,</quote> <trans><tr>concubinage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10919.10" n="b" level="4"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si hominis contubernium passa est (bestia immanis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10919.11" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitatis et moderationis dividuum contubernium est,</quote> <trans><tr>dwell not, exist not together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10919.12" n="II" level="1"> Concr. (acc. to I. A. and B.). </sense><sense id="n10919.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A common wartent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 41 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10919.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dwelling of different persons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10919.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The dwelling of a couple who are slaves, a slave dwelling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10919.16" n="3" level="3"> Of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 10, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contueor: <entryFree id="n10920" type="main" key="contu^e^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭĕor</orth>, <itype>ŭĭtus, 2</itype> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; access. form <sense id="n10920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contuimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> contui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 152</bibl>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 31</bibl>; cf. tueor and intueor; and in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form contuo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl>, or Fragm. v. 95 Vahl.), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10920.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look on, gaze upon, behold, survey, to consider attentively</hi> (syn. conspicio; rare but class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10920.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occepi contui, conspicio coleatam cuspidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:1" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">totam terram contueri ejusque situm, formam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sedem et aeternam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te duobus oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinqua (opp. prope admota non cernere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:142 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 142 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">id novum Agesilaus contuens,</quote> <trans><tr>beholding this novelty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui acrius contuenti voltum summittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 132</bibl>.—Of a place personified: Acrocorinthus utraque maria contuens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 57, 146</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10920.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take into view, to weigh</hi>, <cb n="CONT" /> <hi rend="ital">ponder maturely, to observe</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene propositum si plane contueare, Ac videas plane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a contuendis malis avocare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10920.4" n="b" level="4"> With the access. idea of carefulness, <hi rend="ital">to see to, take care of, preserve carefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus sic contuendum, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10920.5" n="II" level="1"> Inchoat. (cf. conspicio, II.), <hi rend="ital">to get sight of, perceive, descry</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si volturios forte possis contui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuras miras simulacraque in somnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contuitus: <entryFree id="n10921" type="main" key="contu^i^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contueor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10922" type="main" key="contu^i^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭĭtus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">contūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contueor</etym>, <sense id="n10922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attentive looking at, a view, sight</hi> (rare, and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): fugat te ipsum a tuo contutu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contuitu utilitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>in view of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, § 51 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
contumacia: <entryFree id="n10923" type="main" key="contu^ma_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contumax</etym>, <sense id="n10923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perseverance in one's purpose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, generally in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">arrogance, inflexibility, contumacy, obstinacy, stubbornness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10923.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10923.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (in good prose, and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa tua singularis insolentia, superbia, contumacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:41:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41, § 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contumacia et adrogantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumacia et ferocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter abruptam contumaciam et deforme obsequium pergere iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris oculorumque illa contumacia ac superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus principem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem in vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsi tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:31:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 31, 78</bibl></cit>.— Sometimes in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">firmness, constancy, self-confidence</hi> (cf. contumax): <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates adhibuit liberam contumaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maxima innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10923.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an obstinate disobedience to a judicial order, an obstinate refusal to appear in court, contumacy</hi>, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 57</bibl> (65), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">contumacia eorum, qui jus dicenti non temperant, litis damno coërcetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 53</bibl></cit> pr.; cf. contumax, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n10923.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">contumacia pervicax boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum (with fastidium),</quote> <trans><tr>obstinacy in growth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contumaciter: <entryFree id="n10924" type="main" key="contu^ma_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contumax <sense id="n10924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contumax: <entryFree id="n10925" type="main" key="contu^max"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭmax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from the root tem, whence also temno; cf. contemno, and contumelia</etym>, <sense id="n10925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insolent, unyielding, obstinate, stiff-necked, stubborn, contumacious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10925.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10925.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (freq. and in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quis contum acior? quis inhumanior? quis superbior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sara in me contumax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">populus regibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 644" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus (together with arrogans, securus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animus (with arrogantia oris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaces et mconsultae voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>: filii, Cod. Th. 8, 14, 1.—Rarely in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">unyielding, firm, steadfast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumax etiam adversus tormenta servorum fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. contumacia).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanis ego contumax capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna contumacissimum quemque aggreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 83, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10925.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">that refuses to appear in a court of justice in obedience to a lawful summons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumax est, qui ... litteris evocatus, praesentiam, sui facere contemnet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:53:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 53, § 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. contumacia, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n10925.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina ad concubitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">not yielding, furnishing opposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardamum frianti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 29, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba,</quote> <trans><tr>not fitting into measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">obstinately, stubbornly</hi>, etc.: contumaciter, arroganter, <foreign lang="greek">a)koinwnh/tws</foreign> solet ad me scribere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaciter urbaneque vexatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 11</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 5</bibl>.—In a good sense (cf. contumax and contumacia), <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § 15.—</sense><sense id="n10925.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides scalpturae resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 7, 35, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contumelia: <entryFree id="n10926" type="main" key="contu^me_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭmēlĭa</orth> (post-class. access. form <cb n="CONT" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 424</bibl>; cf.: contumia contumelia, Gloss. Isid.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from a root tem, whence also temno, contemno, and contumax; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 1</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n10926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abuse, insult, affront, reproach, invective, contumely</hi> (cf.: injuria, <foreign lang="greek">u(/bris</foreign>; very freq. and class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">contumelia a contemptu dicta est, quia nemo nisi quem contempsit, tali injuriā notat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: patior facile injuriam, si est vacua a contumeliā, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 430, 16</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Caecil. ib.: contumeliam alteri facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl> (8), 79; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliam dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 22, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliam si dicis, audies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricum perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta contumelia accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus tu privatim injurias plurimas contumeliasque imposuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignitates contumeliasque perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: graves, <hi rend="ital">severe reproaches</hi> (opp. libera consilia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in suam contumeliam vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per contumeliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliā perfugae appellari ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 6</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in contumeliam ignominiamque nostram certare juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliae verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">violation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 2</bibl>; Auct. Har. Resp. 20, 42.—The expression facere contumeliam is censured by Cic. (Phil. 3, 9, 22) in the words of Antonius: nulla contumelia est, quam facit dignus; but it is not clear on what grounds (whether as an archaism, or because it is used after the analogy of jacturam facere, in the sense of contumelia adfici); v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 13</bibl>, and cf. esp. Gronov. Observv. 3, 8, pp. 488-502 (pp. 241-247 Frotsch.).—Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Contŭmē-lĭa</orth>, like <foreign lang="greek">*(/ubris</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10926.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">injury, assault, annoyance, violence, blows</hi>, etc. ( = injuria): <cit><quote lang="la">naves totae factae ex robore ad quamvis vim et contumeliam perferendam,</quote> <trans><tr>injury, violence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeberi ora contumeliis,</quote> <trans><tr>to the blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitatis suae,</quote> <trans><tr>annoyance, hardship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. injuria.</sense></entryFree>
contumeliose: <entryFree id="n10927" type="main" key="contu^me_li^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmēlĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contumeliosus <sense id="n10927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contumeliosus: <entryFree id="n10928" type="main" key="contu^me_li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmēlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contumelia</etym>, <sense id="n10928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of abuse, reproachful, insolent, abusive</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">partim te superbum esse dicunt, quod nihil respondeas, partim contumeliosum, quod male respondeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti beneficio Antonii contumelioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam contumeliosus in edictis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliosum id militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et minaci et contumaci epistulă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 33</bibl></cit> pr.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">paregxei/rhsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus acclamationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:6" default="NO">12, 5, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmēlĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">abusively, insolently</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere de absentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliose et aspere dicere in adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 28 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contumesco: <entryFree id="n10929" type="hapax" key="contu^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to swell greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gingivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:4:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 4, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contumia: <entryFree id="n10930" type="main" key="contu^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. contumelia <sense id="n10930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contumulo: <entryFree id="n10931" type="main" key="contu^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tŭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n10931.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To heap up like a mound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis stragulum molle pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10931.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with a mound, to inter, bury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucium ingestā humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:460" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 460</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:57:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 57, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contundo: <entryFree id="n10932" type="main" key="contundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tundo</orth>, <itype>tŭdi, tūsum</itype> (tunsum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 27, 101, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 16, 62, § 221 al.</bibl>), 3 (<sense id="n10932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> contūdit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 891</bibl> P., or Ann. v. 482 Vahl.; but contŭdit, id. ap. Prisc. l. l., or Ann. v. 387 Vahl.), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to beat, bruise, grind, crush, pound, break to pieces</hi> (syn.: confringo, debilito; very freq. and class. in prose and poetry; not in Quint.; for in 11, 2, 13, confudit is the better reading). </sense><sense id="n10932.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10932.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: oleas in lentisco, Cato. <pb n="461" /> <cb n="CONT" /> R. R. 7, 4 (cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 60</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">thymum in pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">radices ferreis pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: florem nullo aratro, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO">6, 14, 3</bibl>: classis victa, fusa, contusa, fugataque est, Inscr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem male fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pugiles caestibus contusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:98" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem planā palmā (with caedere pectus pugnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contusi ac debilitati inter saxa rupesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares a fronte resimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to squeeze together, press in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 96</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of part: <cit><quote lang="la">asper equus duris contunditur ora lupatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of the beating to pieces of crops by hail: <cit><quote lang="la">vites grando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 29</bibl>: non verberatae grandine vineae);
