<cit><quote lang="la">and of lameness produced by disease, etc.: postquam illi justa cheragra Contudit articulos ( = debilitavit nodis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 58</bibl>: cum lapidosa cheragra fregerit articulos, <hi rend="ital">has crippled</hi>).— </sense><sense id="n10932.3" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contūsum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tun-sum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bruise, contusion</hi> (cf. contusio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 209" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n10932.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break, lessen, weaken, destroy, subdue, put down, baffle, check</hi>, etc. (syn.: frango, obtero, vinco): virosque valentes contudit crudelis hiems, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 891</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. v. 387</bibl> and 482 Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora conturbant magno contusa labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:958" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 958</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocem Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae opes contusae hostiumque auctae erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contudi animum et fortasse vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos feros placidā arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contudi et fregi exsultantis praedonis audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam et stultitiam (with obtrivit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum tumidas minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium patientia longa laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta Talthybi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to surpass by my own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>. (But in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 692</bibl>, concludit is the right reading, Lachm., Munro.)</sense></entryFree>
contunsum: <entryFree id="n10933" type="main" key="contunsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contunsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contundo, I. B.</entryFree>
contunsus: <entryFree id="n10934" type="main" key="contunsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contunsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. contundo <sense id="n10934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contuo: <entryFree id="n10935" type="main" key="contu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭo</orth>, v contueor <sense id="n10935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contuoli: <entryFree id="n10936" type="gloss" key="contu^o^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭŏli ŏcŭli</orth> <itype>sunt in angustum coacti conniventibus palpebris</itype>, i. e. <sense id="n10936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eyes narrowed by a partial closing of the eyelid</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 1</bibl> Müll. [contueor].</sense></entryFree>
contuor: <entryFree id="n10937" type="main" key="contu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contŭor</orth>, <itype>tui</itype>, v contueor <sense id="n10937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conturbatio: <entryFree id="n10938" type="main" key="conturba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conturbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conturbo</etym>, <sense id="n10938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disorder, confusion.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n10938.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: oculorum, <hi rend="ital">confused, indistinct vision</hi>, as a disease, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 19" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10938.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">confusion, disquiet, perturbation of mind</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">conturbatio metus excutiens cogitata,</quote> <trans><tr>a fear that drives away all thought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 12, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conturbator: <entryFree id="n10939" type="main" key="conturba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conturbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that brings disorder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (cf. conturbo, II.), <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">ruinous, expensive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">costly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:27:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 96, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conturbatus: <entryFree id="n10940" type="main" key="conturba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conturbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conturbo.</entryFree>
conturbo: <entryFree id="n10941" type="main" key="conturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to throw into disorder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confusion, to confuse, derange, disorder, confound</hi> (rare, but class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in Lucr. and Cic.; not in Verg., Hor., or Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10941.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10941.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">posituras principiorum corporis atque animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 943</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:958" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 958</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:483 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 483 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines Romanorum (militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 98:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 98, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 79, 7</bibl></cit>: annus neglegentiā conturbatus atque confusus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima vulnera novis plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1070" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1070</bibl></cit>: basia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to exchange in confused multitudes</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 11</bibl>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes, i. e. implicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10941.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb, disquiet in mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo tua me valde conturbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est? num conturbo te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidunt multae causae, quae conturbent animos utilitatis specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vemens violentia vini Conturbare animum consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 483</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt, quae conturbent in deliberatione non numquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10941.4" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="CONU" /> In partic., t. t. in the lang. of business: conturbare rationes or rationem, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> conturbare, <hi rend="ital">to bring one's pecuniary affairs into disorder, to become bankrupt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10941.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem sibi commissam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse, quod posthac arcae nostrae fiducia conturbaret,</quote> <trans><tr>bring into pecuniary embarrassment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl></cit> (12), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">fac me multis debere, et in his Plancio: utrum igitur me conturbare oportet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo Graecus, qui conturbat et idem putat sibi licere quod equitibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:16" default="NO">15, 3, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:3:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 3, 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:129 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 129 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10941.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque edepol quid nunc consili capiam scio De virgine istac: ita conturbasti mihi Rationes omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>you have so disturbed all my plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contur-bātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">distracted, disturbed, confused, disquieted</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oculus,</quote> <trans><tr>diseased, disordered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo tristis et conturbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eram in scribendo conturbatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conturmalis: <entryFree id="n10942" type="main" key="conturma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-turmālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the same squadron</hi> (turma) (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 45 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10942.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis operae,</quote> <trans><tr>a companion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conturmo: <entryFree id="n10943" type="main" key="conturmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-turmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to arrange in squadrons</hi> (turmae). se, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contus: <entryFree id="n10944" type="greek" key="contus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">konto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n10944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pole, pike</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.), as an implement of a boat or ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a weapon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 510</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 44</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non contis et remulco ferri, ut aiunt, sed velificatione plenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedalis, i. q. membrum virile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contusio: <entryFree id="n10945" type="main" key="contu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contundo</etym>, <sense id="n10945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crushing, breaking, battering, bruising</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10945.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falcis hebetioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10945.2" n="II" level="1"> In medic. language, <hi rend="ital">a bruise, contusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:165" default="NO">165</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
contusum: <entryFree id="n10946" type="main" key="contu_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contūsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contundo, I. B.</entryFree>
contusus: <entryFree id="n10947" type="main" key="contu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contundo.</entryFree>
contutor: <entryFree id="n10948" type="main" key="contu_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint-guardian</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:29" default="NO">3, 5, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10949" type="main" key="contu_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to place in safety</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contutus: <entryFree id="n10950" type="main" key="contu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 2. contuitus.</entryFree>
conubialis: <entryFree id="n10951" type="main" key="co_nu_bi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnūbĭālis</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">connū-bĭālis</orth>; in the poets gen. to be read as four syll.; cf. conubium; only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 2, 18</bibl>, cōnŭbiālis), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conubium</etym>, <sense id="n10951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to wedlock, connubial, conjugal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. first used by Ov.): jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epist. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. 7, p. 244</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cō-nūbĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a conjugal manner, connubially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procum allegaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 576</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conubialiter: <entryFree id="n10952" type="main" key="co_nu_bi^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnūbĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conubialis <sense id="n10952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conubium: <entryFree id="n10953" type="main" key="co_nu_bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnūbĭum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">connū-bĭum</orth>; cf. Rib. prol. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 393</bibl>), ii (m the poets often trisyl., thus: <sense id="n10953.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">conubio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 428</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 168</bibl>; v. Wagn. and Forbig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl>; and cf. conubialis), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nubo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">marriage, wedlock</hi> (considered as a civil institution; while conjugium had regard to the physical union, cf. Dict. of. Antiq.). </sense><sense id="n10953.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (very freq. in prose and poetry), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 6, 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:141" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 136</bibl>; v. the passages cited, <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, from Verg. and Ov.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of a single marriage (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhin' conubia servas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:421" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 421</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10953.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10953.3" n="A" level="2"> = jus conubii or conubii societas, <hi rend="ital">the right to intermarry</hi>, according to Roman principles: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia illi (sc. decemviri) ut ne plebi et patribus essent, inhumanissimā lege sanxerunt, quae postea plebei scito Canulejo abrogatast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:23" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43, 23</bibl> and 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, § 55 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n10953.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sexual union</hi> (cf. conjugium, II. B. 1.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 777</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1011" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1011</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 21</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10953.5" n="C" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">an ingrafting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16</bibl>, pr. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
conula: <entryFree id="n10954" type="main" key="co_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, = polion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>. <cb n="CONV" /></sense></entryFree>
conus: <entryFree id="n10955" type="greek" key="co_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n10955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cone.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10955.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 430</bibl> and 432; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 47 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10955.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of conical bodies, </sense><sense id="n10955.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The apex of a helmet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 468</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 14, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10955.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The cone of the cypress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10955.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convador: <entryFree id="n10956" type="hapax" key="conva_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vādor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to bind one to appear in court by giving surely;</hi> facete: ubi tu es, qui me convadatus Veneriis vadimoniis, <hi rend="ital">cited me to the court of Venus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">made an appointment with me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convalescens: <entryFree id="n10957" type="main" key="conva^lescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convălescens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> and <sense id="n10957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, v. convalesco, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
convalescentia: <entryFree id="n10958" type="hapax" key="conva^lescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convălescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convalesco</etym>, <sense id="n10958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">convalescence, a regaining of health</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
convalesco: <entryFree id="n10959" type="main" key="conva^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vălesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to recover from a disease, to regain health, to grow strong, gain strength</hi>, etc. (very freq., and class.). </sense><sense id="n10959.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">ex, de, ab</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec omnes, qui curari se passi sunt, continuo etiam convalescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: eum sustulere (defatigatum vulneribus), isque convaluit, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aegri quidem quia non omnes convalescunt, idcirco ars nulla medicina est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a solis ardoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 54</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vălescentes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">subst., those who are convalescent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 17</bibl>, §§ 34 and 35; <cit><quote lang="la">31, 9, 45, § 102 al.: agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrive, grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:1" default="NO">4, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of drooping branches of trees: veterrimae ilicis demissos jam ad terram languentesque ramos convaluisse adventu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestifer ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 478</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma magnā congerie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10959.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10959.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut convalescere aliquando et sanari civitas posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo in dies convalescebat,</quote> <trans><tr>gained strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tandem annona convaluit,</quote> <trans><tr>grew better, became cheaper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala per longas moras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio inveterata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opinio vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama mortis suae apud barbaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10959.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to receive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">possess value, become valid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas servo data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:7:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convallatio: <entryFree id="n10960" type="hapax" key="convalla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convallātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convallo</etym>, <sense id="n10960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intrenchment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convallia: <entryFree id="n10961" type="main" key="convalli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convallĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. convallis.</entryFree>
convallis: <entryFree id="n10962" type="main" key="convallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vallis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly convalle, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:679 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 679 al.</bibl>: <sense id="n10962.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">convalli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> convallium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 100</bibl>). <gen>f.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> post-class. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">convallia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, sc. loca, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 331 al.), <hi rend="ital">a valley enclosed on all sides;</hi> cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 6</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 20</bibl> ib. (freq. and class. in prose and poetry); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 276</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 36</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
convallo: <entryFree id="n10963" type="main" key="convallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">to surround with an intrenchment;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to surround, encircle</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terras omnes Oceani ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. de Judicio Dom. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convario: <entryFree id="n10964" type="main" key="conva^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vărĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (post-class.). <sense id="n10964.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to variegate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutim maculationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10964.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be different, to vary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convaso: <entryFree id="n10965" type="main" key="conva_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vāso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vasa</etym>, <sense id="n10965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pack vessels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">implements together, to pack up</hi> (the figure taken from milit. lang.; anteand post-class. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n10965.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aliquid convasassem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 13</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10965.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">acclamationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to pile up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
convectio: <entryFree id="n10966" type="hapax" key="convecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conveho</etym>, <sense id="n10966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convecto: <entryFree id="n10967" type="main" key="convecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear, carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring together in abundance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">recentes praedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 749</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligones, dolabras, etc., e proximis agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: paleas, ligna, Cod. Th. 7, 4, 9; 13, 5, 10. <pb n="462" /> <cb n="CONV" /></sense></entryFree>
convector: <entryFree id="n10968" type="main" key="convector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conveho</etym>, <sense id="n10968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brings together;</hi> hence, Convector, <hi rend="ital">the deity who presided over the gathering in of grain</hi>, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10969" type="main" key="convector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who goes with one</hi> (on board ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a fellow-passenger</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conveho: <entryFree id="n10970" type="main" key="conve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĕho</orth>, <itype>vexi, vectum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to carry, bear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10970.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum ex finitimis regionibus in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 39, 11 al.</bibl>: lintribus in eam insulam materiem, calcem, caementa, arma, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus collectum Sabota camelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 20, § 64</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique convehunt apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum habere convectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n10970.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of the harvest, <hi rend="ital">to gather, get in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus in villas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 35</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa corbisque ac patentiora quaedam messibus convehendis vindemiisque faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 9, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convello: <entryFree id="n10971" type="main" key="convello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vello</orth>, <itype>velli</itype> (convulsi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 4</bibl>), vulsum (volsum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10971.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw violently hither and thither something that is firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (esp. a tree, house, and the like); hence, <hi rend="ital">to tear up, wrest from its position, to tear loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away, to separate from, pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pluck up</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10971.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10971.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10971.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Without designation of place from which, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praecides caveto ne librum convellas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa turris hostium, quibus fundamenta continebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:26" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gradus Castoris convellisti ac removisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aesculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convellere repagula, effringere valvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina tectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 507</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 528</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 344</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the rack: omnia (membra) laniata, omnes partes convulsae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convolsis laceratisque membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 6; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">armos,</quote> <trans><tr>to wrench, dislocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros fetus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to produce abortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With designation of place from or out of which, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum Cereris e sacrario convellendum auferendumque curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">186: me ex nostris hortulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridem silvam ab humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem ab terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(turrim) convellimus altis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora suā terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma prope convulsa sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus convulsa sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera undique nisu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:159" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeserunt radice pedes. Convellere pugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 351</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: signa, <hi rend="ital">to pluck up the standards from the ground, to decamp</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vexilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">convulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-volsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">suffering from wrenching of a limb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 98</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 5, 18, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:178" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 17, 69, § 178</bibl>; or <hi rend="ital">from convulsions, spasmodic, convulsive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to totter, to shake, to destroy, overthrow, bring to naught</hi> (syn.: labefacto, commoveo, commuto, infirmo; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): est boni consulis, cum cuncta auxilia rei publicae labefactari convellique videat, ferre opëm patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with labefactare: cogitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit> Manut.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae non possint commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si tenemus, quae mihi quidem non videntur posse convelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia, stipulationes, etc. (with infirmare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convellere et commutare instituta omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta Dolabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam judicio aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires aegri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">11: fidem legionum promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede Messalinae convulsa principis domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 65</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 40: Tiberius vi dominationis convulsus ( = abalienatus ab honestate) et mutatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secutae sunt duae (epistulae), quae me convellerunt de pristino statu, jam tamen labantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="CONV" /> </sense><sense id="n10971.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rend to pieces, to cleave, dismember, shatter, break</hi> (perh. first in the poets of the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n10971.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes avido dente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 123</bibl></cit>: glaebam vomere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehiscit Convolsum remis rostrisque tridentibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 690</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca vi quondam et vastā convolsa ruinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem (naves) convolsae undis Euroque supersunt,</quote> <trans><tr>shattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 383</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 528</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convulsi laniatique centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10971.12" n="1" level="3"> Of words, <hi rend="ital">to mutilate, mispronounce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno cursu verba convellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10971.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To afflict, torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis convellere pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convelo: <entryFree id="n10972" type="main" key="conve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to veil, to cover over</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10972.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10972.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <foreign lang="greek">e)pagwgh/n</foreign> multis argumentis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:44" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
convena: <entryFree id="n10973" type="main" key="conve^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n10973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comm.</hi> [convenio], <hi rend="ital">coming together, meeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, qui amantis unā inter se facerem convenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 6, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenā undique multitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">comm., a multitude collected together, assembled strangers, refugees, tramps</hi>, etc.: eodem convenae complures ex agro accessitavere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus pastores et convenas congregasse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 17</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 17, 15, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Dionysius) quibusdam convenis et feris barbaris corporis custodiam committebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10973.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Convĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the mixed people, the Refugees, a community gathered by Pompey at the foot of the Pyrenees, on the Garumna</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">St. Bertrand des Comminges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Vigil. IV. p. 282</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conveniens: <entryFree id="n10974" type="main" key="conve^ni^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from convenio.</entryFree>
convenienter: <entryFree id="n10975" type="main" key="conve^ni^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. convenio, <sense id="n10975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
convenientia: <entryFree id="n10976" type="main" key="conve^ni^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>convenio, II. A. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n10976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting together, agreement, accord, harmony, symmetry, conformity, suitableness, fitness</hi> (a Ciceronian philosoph. word). </sense><sense id="n10976.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenientia naturae cum extis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: convenientia et conjunctio naturae, quam vocant <foreign lang="greek">sumpa/qeian</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 124</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">convenientia conservatioque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partium (with pulchritudo, venustas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum (in cursibus stellarum, with constantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum in amicitiā (with stabilitas, constantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10976.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quod (summum bonum) cum positum sit in eo, quod <foreign lang="greek">o(mologi/an</foreign> Stoici, nos appellemus convenientiam, si placet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus convenientiā constat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
convenio: <entryFree id="n10977" type="main" key="conve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n10977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> convenibo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 18</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10977.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To come together, meet together, assemble</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n10977.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, qui ex provinciā convenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ... eo convenerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius fere Galliae legati ad Caesarem gratulatum convenerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto multitudo hominum ad hoc judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici privatique hospites ad eum defendendum convenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad clamorem hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad delectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pericles, cum haberet collegam Sophoclem, iique de communi officio convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Off. 1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ita convenimus, ut possemus dicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Phil. 3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam convenimus ambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:361 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 361 al.</bibl>—With the place to or at which, usu. designated by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei capitis servandi causā Romam Italia tota convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum in locum omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in coetus scholarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consilium frequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reguli in unum convenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis non desistebant clam inter se convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ex proximis hibernis et a Caesare conventura subsidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: convenientis manus dissipare, Auct. B. G. 8, 6.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> of place (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">uno in loco omnes adversariorum copiae convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf.: quanta illic multitudo convenisse<cb n="CONV" />  dicebatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl> B. and K. (al. illuc): <cit><quote lang="la">in coloniā Agrippiensi in domum privatam conveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">munera multa huc ab amatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc convenit utrumque bivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppi dum in quo omnis negotiatio ejus (Arabiae) convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multae causae convenisse unum in locum atque inter se congruere videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10977.5" n="1" level="3"> Publicist. t. t. of civil communities which belong in jurisdiction to some chief city: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his civitatibus, quae in id forum convenirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem conveniunt populi LXV.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Aethiopicae convenere naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.6" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">in manum, of a woman who in marriage (by usus, confarreatio, or coëmptio, q. v.) comes into the hands (manus) of her husband,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 34, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro in manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manum flaminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the same sense: in matrimonium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:121:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 121, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in matrimonium cum viro,</quote> <trans><tr>to marry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; or, in nuptias, Cod. Th. 3, 7, 11.—</sense><sense id="n10977.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to go to one</hi> to speak to him, make a request of him, etc., <hi rend="ital">to address, accost, meet, visit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haut multos homines nunc videre et convenire quam te mavellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:74 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 74 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Helvetii) cum eum (sc. Caesarem) in itinere convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Atilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem conveni—convenio autem cottidie plurimos—quin omnes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruti pueri Laodiceae me convenerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balbus tantis pedum doloribus afficitur, ut se conveniri nolit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eum (Lentulum) a minore Balbo conventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod conveniundi patris me tempus capere jubebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 3 al.</bibl> —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum petentibus conveniendi non dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.8" n="b" level="4"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to meet one judicially, to sue, bring an action against, summon before a tribunal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut heredes ex stipulatu conveniri possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:17" default="NO">50, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de peculio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro parte dimidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 59</bibl></cit> et saep.—Also with abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum aut culpam eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10977.9" n="II" level="1"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n10977.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come together, to unite, join, combine, couple</hi> (cf. coëo, II.). </sense><sense id="n10977.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, so mostly of the coition of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 922</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 29, § 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 38 al.</bibl>—Of the union of atoms: <cit><quote lang="la">Tandem conveniant ea (primordia) quae convecta repente Magnarum rerum fiunt exordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10977.13" n="a" level="4"> With personal subject, <hi rend="ital">to agree with in wishes, decisions</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to accord, harmonize</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 1, § 5</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5</bibl>, the v. 130 is spurious; v. Ritschl, prol. ad Trin. p. 131).—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10977.14" n="b" level="4"> Res convenit or <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> convenit, <hi rend="ital">it is agreed upon</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">there is unanimity in respect to something, the matter is decided.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10977.15" n="(a)" level="5"> Res convenit, constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui cum aliquo, inter aliquos</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his mihi nec locus nec sermo convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fratri mecum non conveniunt neque placent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dote mecum conveniri nil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi cum tuo fratre convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax, quae cum T. Quinctio convenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 43, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pax convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 43, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eas condiciones cum pax conveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 12, 14 al.</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum imperatoribus Romanis pacem conventam fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio accepti atque expensi inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo signo quod convenerat revocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tempus inter eos committendi proelii convenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem voluerunt majores nostri esse judicem, nisi qui inter adversarios convenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:43:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 43, 120</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">judex inter eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse rem convenire ... si posset inter eos aliquid convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rem conventuram putamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in eo manerent, quod convenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <pb n="463" /> <cb n="CONV" /> in colloquium convenit; <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones non convenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 11, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ardentia vidit castra magister equitum (id convenerat signum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia conventura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem conventam frustra fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus conventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10977.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Convenit, constr. <hi rend="ital">alicui cum aliquo, inter aliquos</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cum Deiotaro convenit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idne agebas, ut tibi cum sceleratis, an ut cum bonis civibus conveniret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicum optime convenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ita convenit inter me atque hunc, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2</bibl></cit>. 3, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo inter Patres, sed ne inter consules
