quidem ipsos satis conveniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniat mihi tecum necesse est, ipsum fecisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter omnis vero convenit, Sibyllam ad Tarquinium Superbum tris libros attulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 25</bibl>: convenit, jam inde per consules reliqua belli perfecta, <hi rend="ital">it is generally asserted</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o(mologei=tai</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de facto convenit, et quaeritur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de duobus minus convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam de hoc parum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam sunt, de quibus inter omnes convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:28" default="NO">4, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi de pace non convenit, signa cecinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:59 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 59 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit, victi utri sint eo proelio, Urbem, agrum, etc.... seque uti dederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenerat, ne interloquereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus consulibus interierit non convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacto convenit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis exercitus, uti convenerat. Numidiā deductus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patres igitur jurati (ita enim convenerat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro argento si aurum dare mallent, darent convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.17" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fit with, in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to something, to suit, be adapted to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10977.18" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (cupa) inter orbes conveniat ... quae (fistula) in columellam conveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniebatne in vaginam tuam machaera militis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cothurni laus illa esset, ad pedem apte convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 46</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10977.19" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: res convenit, or <hi rend="ital">impers</hi>. convenit, <hi rend="ital">the thing</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">it</hi>) <hi rend="ital">is fit, becoming, seemly, suitable, appropriate, proper, serviceable for something, it becomes</hi>, = consentit, congruit. </sense><sense id="n10977.20" n="a" level="4"> Res convenit, constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid, cum aliquā re</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">dat., acc., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10977.21" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae vites in quemvis agrum conveniunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:19:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid minus in hunc ordinem convenit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenire quae vitia in quemvis videntur potius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in te unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr</hi>. nullam contumeliam jacere potueris, quae non ad maximam partem civium conveniret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 7, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.22" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tua deliberatio non mihi convenire visa est cum oratione Largi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:73 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 73 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10977.23" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num videntur convenire haec nuptiis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10977.24" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itidem ut tempus anni, aetatem aliam aliud factum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit> dub. (Lachm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 64</bibl>, conj. condecet).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non convenit, me ... agrum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 41</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil autem minus in perfecto duce quam festinationem ... convenire arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: hanc mi expetivi, contigit; <cit><quote lang="la">conveniunt mores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen non convenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 3</bibl> (cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: rationes conferatis; adsidunt; <cit><quote lang="la">subducunt: ad nummum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">non bene conveniunt, nec in unā sede morantur Majestas et amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius ille orationis modus maxime convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10977.25" n="b" level="4"> Convenit, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, constr. with a clause as subject (so esp. freq. in Lucr. <cb n="CONV" /> and the elder Pliny). </sense><sense id="n10977.26" n="(a)" level="5"> Haud convenit, unā ire cum amicā imperatorem in viā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit illud in his rebus obsignatum habere, Lucr 2, 582: per se sibi vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere causas leti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 708</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo maxime contendi conveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit Evandri victos discedere ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 184</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 33, § 126</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 1, 5, § 15</bibl> Sillig.—</sense><sense id="n10977.27" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī enim convenit, ut? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (al. evenit): <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi curae Quantae conveniat Munatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl>. —To express assent: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit,</quote> <trans><tr>well, it is agreed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10977.28" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10977.29" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Agreeing, consistent, accordant, harmonious</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">consentiens, concors, congruens): bene convenientes propinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">convenientes optime propinqui cognatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta et convenientia et constantia natura desiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniens et conjuncta constantia inter augures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1029" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1029</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 941</bibl></cit>.—More frequently, </sense><sense id="n10977.30" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Fitting to something, appropriate to, meet, fit, suitable</hi>, = congruens; constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">dat., ad aliquid, inter se, in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> or <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10977.31" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (rare): motus oris conveniens cum ipsius verbi demonstratione, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies conveniens cum populi vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10977.32" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil in hac praeclarā epistulā scriptum ab Epicuro congruens et conveniens decretis ejus reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:102 al" default="NO">6, 3, 102 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 36</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut sibi convenientia finge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono civi convenientissimum credidi amplecti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina convenientissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.33" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ad aliquid</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam conveniens ad res vel secundas vel adversas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus ad formam tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:436" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 436</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10977.34" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">forma in illam conveniens amplitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">In aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulatio conveniens in eā victoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Inter se</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in vitā omnia sint apta inter se et convenientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:941" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 941</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod sit aptum atque conveniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <trans><tr>fitting, fitting close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil convenientius ducens, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10977.35" n="b" level="4"> Conveniens est = convenit, consentaneum est, <hi rend="ital">it is fit, proper, becoming, suitable</hi> (post-Aug. and rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">congruens): convenientius est dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:87:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl> (20), 2.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">convĕnĭen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fitly, suitably, conformably, consistently</hi> (syn.. congruenter, constanter; class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic.): convenienter cum naturā vivere (with congruere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenienter naturae vivere (with congruenter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenienter sibi dicere (with constanter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenienter ad praesentem fortunae statum loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 44.—</sense><sense id="n10977.36" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-ventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">an agreement, compact, covenant, convention, accord</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">facere promissa, stare conventis, reddere deposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 37, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:10 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 10 al.</bibl>—As a jurid. expression, very freq. in the connection pactum conventum (for which the MSS. sometimes, perh. through interpolation, give pactum et conventum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part.
